com.revature.AudiDealership

Class Driver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.revature.AudiDealership.Driver

  • public class Driver
extends java.lang.Object
    A menu driver that displays all the menus in the Audi Dealership Application

    The Audi Dealership application runs through the Driver class.

    Author:
    josecanela

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Driver() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void customerMenu(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Displays the customer menu where a customer is given a choice to either view all the cars on the Audi dealership lot, make an offer on a Audi car that's on the lot, view the cars they've bought and the customer's payment records for that car, view their entire payment history, make a monthly payment on a car, or logout and return to the login menu.
      static void employeeMenu(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      Displays the employee menu where an employee is given a choice to either view all the cars in the Audi Dealership database (including those that have already been bought), add an Audi to the lot, both view and accept a customer's offer on a car, remove a car from the lot, view the cars they own and the customer's payment records for that car, view the payment history of all customers, delete a customer's account, or logout and return to the login menu.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Starts up the application by displaying the main menu of the Audi Dealership Application.
      static void mainMenu()
      Displays the main menu of the application where a user is given a choice to either login, register an account, or close the application.
      static void registrationMenu()
      Displays the registration menu where the user is given a choice to either register an account as a customer, register an account as an employee, or return to the main menu.
      static void signInMenu()
      Displays the login menu of the application where the user is given a choice to either login as an employee, login as a customer, or exit the login menu and return to the main menu.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Starts up the application by displaying the main menu of the Audi Dealership Application.
        Parameters:
        args -

      • mainMenu

        public static void mainMenu()
        Displays the main menu of the application where a user is given a choice to either login, register an account, or close the application.

      • signInMenu

        public static void signInMenu()
        Displays the login menu of the application where the user is given a choice to either login as an employee, login as a customer, or exit the login menu and return to the main menu.

      • registrationMenu

        public static void registrationMenu()
        Displays the registration menu where the user is given a choice to either register an account as a customer, register an account as an employee, or return to the main menu.

        After a user registers, they are automatically sent to the login menu corresponding to the type of user they registered as.

      • customerMenu

        public static void customerMenu(java.lang.String username,
                                java.lang.String password)
        Displays the customer menu where a customer is given a choice to either view all the cars on the Audi dealership lot, make an offer on a Audi car that's on the lot, view the cars they've bought and the customer's payment records for that car, view their entire payment history, make a monthly payment on a car, or logout and return to the login menu.

        After a choice has made (that does not consist of logging out) and when the customer is done following through on that decision, they will be returned to the customer menu.

        Parameters:
        username - the customer's username
        password - the customer's password

      • employeeMenu

        public static void employeeMenu(java.lang.String username,
                                java.lang.String password)
        Displays the employee menu where an employee is given a choice to either view all the cars in the Audi Dealership database (including those that have already been bought), add an Audi to the lot, both view and accept a customer's offer on a car, remove a car from the lot, view the cars they own and the customer's payment records for that car, view the payment history of all customers, delete a customer's account, or logout and return to the login menu.

        After a choice has made (that does not consist of logging out) and when the employee is done following through on that decision, they will be returned to the employee menu.

        Parameters:
        username - the employee's username
        password - the employee's password
